title: Coach Prime‚Äôs Ex-Wife Pilar Sanders Shines Light on Shilo‚Äôs Feat as Shedeur‚Äôs Powerhouse Performance Steals the Spotlight - EssentiallySports
text: Yes, we get it. Shedeur Sanders has all the eyes on him right now. And honestly, that guy deserves it. He managed to lock in around 4 touchdowns and 1 interception. Not only that, he ran for 445 yards. That is a major thing. This was the same dude who was marked as the ‚Äúmost sacked QB‚Äù last season and also as ‚Äúoverrated‚Äù by many analysts or media outlets. This time around, after the amazing season opener win against the Bisons, Shedeur has managed to make this season the year of redemption for Deion Sanders and the Buffs. However, don‚Äôt y‚Äôall think we are missing someone here? We have said it before and we will say it again. Coach Prime‚Äôs ex-wife Pilar Sanders deserves the ‚ÄúMother of the Year‚Äù award. Cause when no one was talking about how good Shilo Sanders performed, she made sure on September 6th that people knew how the younger brother managed to do against NDSU. Pilar took to her Instagram to share stats of Shilo during the NDSU game. The dude has managed to pull in 9 solid tackles throughout the game. Not only that, he achieved a defensive grade of 71.8. ‚ÄúCONGRATULATIONS SON!!!! üó£Ô∏è Go #shilosanders,‚Äù Pilar wrote on her Instagram. Back in July [https://www.essentiallysports.com/nfl-ncaa-news-who-wrote-that-shilo-sanders-shuts-down-shoulder-injury-rumors-setting-the-record-straight-ahead-of-twenty-twenty-four-season/], when Shilo said, ‚ÄúWe definitely have a better chance of winning this year than last year.‚Äù He was not joking around. The season opener gave us a really good idea of how the Buffs would go about with this year‚Äôs run. Yes, we will admit that the offense could‚Äôve been better, but you‚Äôd be lying to yourself if you said Shilo, Shedeur, Travis Hunter, and Jimmy Horn Jr. are not in their best shape this season. While Pilar couldn‚Äôt have been happier with what Shilo had managed to achieve. His older brother, Deion Sanders Jr, was not cool with the way Shilo had played during the season opener. Not only that, the fans were also not happy with what Shilo had showcased during the game. However, what could‚Äôve led to this flood of hate directed toward the young CU Buffs‚Äô safety? SHILO SANDERS PLAYED IT ‚ÄúDIRTY‚Äù Not once, not twice, but 3 times Shilo‚Äôs plays on the field were found questionable. There were 2 instances when he pushed a Bison player into the stadium wall after going out of bounds. Shilo also, for some wild reason, decided to land a late hit on a receiver who had zero defenses around him. This resulted in a penalty for the Bisons and also a set of downs. This also gave Bisons QB Cam Miller the opportunity and score a TD during that drive. Fans called out Shilo as ‚Äúthe dirtiest player in college football‚Äù. Deion Jr. was quick to point out that Shilo‚Äôs game almost risked the Buffs the season opener win. ‚ÄúStupid a‚Äì penalties, Shilo was playing like a crash dummy at times,‚Äù Deion Jr. had noted during a conversation on the Zero 2 Sixty podcast. Bucky aka Deion Jr. and his anger was pretty much justified. Last year as well, we saw the same thing from Shilo causing useless penalties during the third down. While the dude has a lot of potential, he has to work on his overall game ethic. Regardless, let‚Äôs hope during the game against the Cornhuskers, he puts on his good-boy pants.

title: Sciopero, Salvini attacca Landini: "Prepara suo arrivo in Parlamento"
text:
(Adnkronos) - "Mi viene il dubbio che Maurizio Landini non tuteli l'interesse di lavoratrici e lavoratori, ma prepari il suo arrivo in Parlamento". Cos√¨ il ministro dei Trasporti e leader della Lega, Matteo Salvini, torna a parlare del segretario della Cgil a due giorni dallo sciopero generale del 29 novembre e dopo l'annuncio di una nuova mobilitazione per il 13 dicembre.
"Leggevo su qualche giornale che Salvini ce l'ha con Landini. No, la vita √® un dono troppo grande per passare il tempo odiando qualcuno. Per√≤ quando fai lo sciopero generale perch√© 'il governo taglia i fondi alla sanit√†' menti sapendo di mentire... Landini - ha detto il leader della Lega - ha proclamato lo sciopero ancora prima di conoscere la legge di bilancio, lamentando i tagli sulla sanit√† che non ci sono, perch√© in sanit√† ci sono 136 miliardi di euro che √® il record storico per il servizio sanitario nazionale, quindi mi sembra che faccia politica". "E' suo diritto di farlo - osserva - come hanno fatto tutti i segretari della Cgil prima di lui che poi sono entrati in politica, lasciando il diritto di garantire agli italiani che vogliono lavorare tranquilli il diritto di farlo".
Salvini ricorda che "negli ultimi 20 anni solo due governi hanno ridotto gli stanziamenti sanitari rispetto all'anno precedente: si parla di due governi a guida Partito democratico e non ci furono scioperi generali. Allora mi viene il dubbio che il signor Landini non tuteli l'interesse di lavoratrici e lavoratori, ma prepari il suo arrivo in Parlamento come parlamentare della sinistra, come hanno fatto tutti i predecessori alla guida della Cgil. E quindi io ritengo mio diritto e mio dovere intervenire per garantire il diritto allo sciopero, che √® sacrosanto, ma anche il diritto al lavoro".
Collegandosi con l'assemblea nazionale di Noi Moderati a Roma, sottolinea che "ci sono altri 15 scioperi solo nel mese di dicembre: se non si conterranno riducendo i disagi per i cittadini, a pochi giorni dal Natale, far√≤ quello che ritengo sia mio diritto e dovere fare da ministro dei Trasporti". E riferendosi al nuovo sciopero annunciato per venerd√¨ 13 dicembre ha assicurato che "se non utilizzeranno il buon senso" ricorrer√≤ "al criterio di garantire per il penultimo venerd√¨ prima di Natale una giornata serena"generale .
‚ÄúIl governo, invece di porsi il problema di come rispondere a 500.000 persone che sono andata in piazza e a milioni di persone che hanno scioperato, continua a dire che il problema √® quello che √® successo a Torino fatto da 100 persone. Si capisce che siamo di fronte a qualcosa che non torna. Perch√© siamo di fronte a una esplicita volont√† di non misurarsi con quella che √® la richiesta che √® stata avanzata", afferma dal canto suo Landini, a margine dell‚Äôassemblea di Europa verde in corso Chianciano terme.
"Io non sto dicendo che noi rappresentavamo tutti, ma da quello che si √® visto venerd√¨ 29 noi rappresentiamo una parte importante di questo Paese, quelli che pagano le tasse, quelli che tengono in piedi questo Paese e una delle rivendicazioni che stiamo facendo ad esempio √® di andare a prendere i soldi dove sono, perch√© in questi due anni i profitti sono aumentati in una maniera esagerata e sono calati i salari e la tassazione sta aumentando sul lavoro dipendente e sui pensionati. Quindi io penso che ci sia un tentativo esplicito, lo ripeto, di svolta autoritaria perch√© quando alle persone che ti chiedono democraticamente di essere ascoltate non rispondi e pensi addirittura di fare un decreto che li arresti se manifestano, ecco io penso che questa √® una svolta autoritaria contraria ai principi della nostra costituzione", aggiunge Landini.

title: How Fleet Connectivity Helps United Kingdom Businesses | Business | Before It's News
text: How Fleet Connectivity Helps United Kingdom Businesses Fleet connectivity has become a transformative tool for businesses in the United Kingdom, particularly those that rely on transportation and logistics. The integration of telematics, GPS tracking, and real-time communication systems has reshaped how businesses manage their fleets, providing multiple operational and financial benefits. This article explores how fleet connectivity aids UK businesses in achieving efficiency, reducing costs, and enhancing overall productivity. Improved Operational Efficiency One of the most significant advantages of fleet connectivity is the ability to streamline operations. With [www.radius.com/en-gb/](http://www.radius.com/en-gb/), fleet managers can monitor vehicle locations and optimize routes, which helps reduce fuel consumption and ensures faster deliveries. For industries like logistics, delivery services, and construction, where time-sensitive deliveries and transport are critical, this technology allows businesses to provide better customer service and minimize delays. By enabling real-time communication between drivers and fleet managers, businesses can also respond quickly to sudden changes, such as road closures or unexpected traffic. Adjusting routes or dispatching vehicles from nearby locations ensures that disruptions are minimized and customer satisfaction is upheld. This level of adaptability is particularly useful in the UK, where variable traffic conditions in densely populated urban areas like London can impact delivery times. Cost Reduction Fleet connectivity directly contributes to cost savings, which is a key concern for any business operating fleets. Fuel consumption is one of the largest expenses for companies in transportation. By using telematics, businesses can monitor driver behavior, such as excessive idling, speeding, or inefficient routing, which all contribute to higher fuel costs. Fleet connectivity systems help identify these inefficiencies and provide recommendations for more fuel-efficient driving practices. Additionally, the real-time maintenance alerts provided by fleet management systems can save businesses significant amounts on repair costs. These systems track vehicle performance and usage patterns, helping fleet managers schedule preventative maintenance rather than dealing with unexpected breakdowns, which can be costly and disruptive. In industries where fleet availability is crucial, such as courier services and heavy goods transport, minimizing vehicle downtime can make a considerable difference to the bottom line. Enhanced Safety and Compliance Fleet connectivity also plays an essential role in improving safety and ensuring compliance with UK transport regulations. Fleet managers can monitor driver behavior, including harsh braking, rapid acceleration, or speeding, and offer targeted driver training to mitigate risky driving habits. By reducing the likelihood of accidents, businesses can not only protect their workforce but also lower insurance premiums. In the UK, fleet operators are required to comply with strict regulations, such as the UK Government‚Äôs Operator Compliance Risk Score (OCRS), which rates how safely and legally fleet operators run their vehicles. Connected fleets simplify regulatory compliance by automatically tracking and recording important data, such as driving hours, vehicle inspections, and maintenance records. This reduces the administrative burden on businesses and ensures they remain compliant with national transport laws. Better Data-Driven Decision-Making Fleet connectivity provides UK businesses with access to vast amounts of data on vehicle performance, driver behavior, fuel efficiency, and delivery times. This data allows companies to make informed decisions to improve operations. author: Sarah Arnold
title: Why the Biden Admin Is Targeting This Christian University Again
text: The Biden Administration's continued efforts to target Christians and conservatives have taken priority on his short list of daily to-do's. President Joe Biden's Federal Trade Commission filed a lawsuit against the largest Christian university in the United States on Wednesday. Grand Canyon University is facing a second lawsuit by an agency under the Biden Administration within the past few months in what the university says is a coordinated attack by multiple agencies against the institution. The lawsuit accuses the university of engaging in fraudulent advertising practices by marketing itself as a nonprofit institution and misrepresenting the price of its doctoral programs. The FTC claims the school has not adequately disclosed the costs of its "continuation courses," which allegedly add thousands of dollars to the publicly disclosed cost of the degree. "Grand Canyon deceived students by holding itself out as a nonprofit institution and misrepresenting the costs and number of courses required to earn doctoral degrees," Samuel Levine, director of the FTC's Bureau of Consumer Protection, [said](https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/news/press-releases/2023/12/ftc-sues-grand-canyon-university-deceptive-advertising-illegal-telemarketing) in a press release. "We will continue aggressively pursuing those who seek to take advantage of students." Recommended According to the lawsuit, the Arizona-based university's "marketing activities have also resulted in millions of abusive telemarketing calls to consumers who have specifically requested that Defendants not solicit them, and to individuals on the National Do Not Call Registry." In October, the Department of Education (ED) fined Grand Canyon University more than $37.7 million after an investigation found the school "consistently misrepresented doctoral program costs." The university claims that the legal battle with the Biden Administration results from a deliberate targeting campaign. The school's president, Brian Mueller, told the Washington Examiner earlier this year that the investigation into Grand Canyon U was launched in lousy faith, calling them "fishing expeditions." "Given the major problems that exist in higher education related to high tuition costs, significant student debt, poor student loan default rates, long completion times, etc., it is baffling that the federal government has chosen to target a Christian university that is addressing those issues in very positive ways," the school said. "No other institution in higher education is facing this level of government scrutiny, which speaks volumes about these agencies' motivations and agenda."
